definition: to read/to study

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: He needs to improve his English before he can study abroad.
sentences.chinese: 他到国外念书之前必须先加强英文。

sentences.english: But yesterday I promised him to work harder.
sentences.chinese: 但是，昨天我向他保证要更用功念书。

sentences.english: That is why I have never been to a normal high school before.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我从来没有进过普通高中念书。

sentences.english: Now he wants to "read" the books to her.
sentences.chinese: 现在他想要为她念书了。

sentences.english: They have sons and daughters who go to school with our son, Dean.
sentences.chinese: 那三位的小孩都跟我们的儿子迪恩在一个学校念书。

sentences.english: He is a boring man. He likes neither entertainment nor reading.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个无聊的人，既不爱文娱，也不爱念书。

sentences.english: Your school in Hefei, Anhui you people?
sentences.chinese: 你在合肥念书，你是安徽人吗？

sentences.english: Many students spend less and less time studying after going to college.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生上了大学后念书的时间愈来愈少。

sentences.english: She and her brother are both at boarding school.
sentences.chinese: 她和她弟弟都在寄宿学校念书。

sentences.english: Reading to children is one of the best ways to encourage interest in reading.
sentences.chinese: 给孩子们念书是激发阅读兴趣最好的办法之一。

sentences.english: The boy dozed off while his mother was reading to him.
sentences.chinese: 男孩的妈妈念书给他听时，他打起瞌睡来了。

sentences.english: My sister studies at Kingsfield High School .
sentences.chinese: 我的姐姐在芝加哥高中念书。

sentences.english: He that can read an meditate will not find hellos evenings long or life tedious.
sentences.chinese: 会念书思索的人不会感应长夜无聊或者生活寡味。

sentences.english: Scates eventually received treatment, and has just started college.
sentences.chinese: 后来，斯盖茨得到了治疗，她开始到社区大学念书。

sentences.english: I know you think Harvard is a school full of really studious, boring bookworms.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你认为上哈佛的，都是只会念书的无聊书呆子。

sentences.english: You know, I didn't study for this English quiz.
sentences.chinese: 你可知道，我没有为这次英语课的测验好好念书。

definition: to go to school/to attend school
to read a book/to study/to attend school
to teach (in a school)
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
to pass a university entrance exam
part work, part study/work-study program
to go to school
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
university/college/CL:所[suo3]
to attend graduate school
studies/schoolwork
to board at school
to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
to change schools/to transfer to another college
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
